module.name: Introduction to Programming in C
module.description: This module introduces students to the core principles of programming using the C language. It covers basic programming constructs such as variables, loops, conditional statements, functions, and pointers. Students will also learn about memory management, file handling, and the use of data structures in C. By the end of the module, students will have the foundational skills necessary for more advanced programming topics.

assessments.name: Basic C Programming
details: Write a set of simple programs that demonstrate your understanding of variables, loops, and conditional statements in C.
Each program should perform a different task (e.g., summing a list of numbers, finding the largest number in an array, etc.).
Include well-commented code and use functions where applicable.

assessments.name: Functions and Pointers
details: Create a program that demonstrates your understanding of functions, pointers, and dynamic memory allocation.
Your program should implement several functions that manipulate data using pointers and include error handling.
The program must handle user input and display the results clearly.

assessments.name: C Programming Project
details: Develop a command-line application that integrates all the concepts learned throughout the module, including functions, pointers, file handling, and memory management.
The project must be well-structured, with clear and concise comments explaining the code.
Include a detailed report that explains how the code works and addresses challenges encountered during development.

steps: Log in to Blackboard using your student credentials.
Navigate to the Introduction to Programming in C (CO105C) module.
Locate the relevant assignment submission link for the respective assignment (Assignment 1, Assignment 2, or Final Project).
Upload your code files, preferably in a compressed zip folder, and ensure that your report is in PDF format.
Once uploaded, click Submit to complete the submission process.
submissionGuidelines.important: Ensure you keep a copy of your submission confirmation/receipt as proof of submission. Always verify the specific instructions provided by your tutor on Blackboard.
